title: Glencore shares surge in Hong Kong as takeover rumours swirl
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Glencore shares surge in Hong Kong as takeover rumours swirl The trading and mining giant may sell off its agricultural business Reuters Marcus Leroux Updated 38 minutes ago 
The uncertainty around Glencore was laid bare this morning when its shares on the Hong Kong market surged by as much as 72 per cent, forcing the company to say it knew of no reason for the buying spree. 
A report at the weekend stated that the company’s management would listen to takeover approaches. While sources close to Glencore insist that the FTSE 100 miner does not believe a bid is likely, the spectacular stock market response demonstrates the febrile atmosphere that has taken hold since the group announced a package of measures to cut its debts by about $10 Subscribe now
